title: How to Polish Stainless Steel
original_title: How To Polish Your Stainless Steel Appliances At Home
content: how to make stainless-steel appliances shine hello and welcome to videojug stainless-steel appliances look great in kitchens but they soon show up every fingerprint and smudge just like this refrigerator santé redmond our cleaning expert from Molly maids is going to show us a great tip for removing these unsightly marks and make the appliance look as good as new step one you will need rubber gloves baby oil a J cloth and a paper towel step 2 rub on squirt a little baby oil onto a J cloth rub it all over this majd area of the appliance step3 buff take a sheet of paper towel and buff work in small circular motions to ensure all smudges are removed pay particular attention to the area around the handle as this is where the most marks will be take your time to get a brilliant shine done

you polish too much with your hands you're never going to overwork the surface you're just not going to take too much effort to actually overwork the surface with a dremel you could overwork the surface but the worst part of a dremel and I've seen people ruin some good guns with a dremel is the shaft that's spinning shaft or the dribble they slip the pad slides off you're doing a corner here careful to never let the shaft touch the gun and never be doing any large areas where I'm moving the Dremel a lot so that's how you polish up a revolver

content: so here we are with this 1982 yamaha virago we're going to be hand polishing the tank so first I spray with a 50/50 mixture of isopropyl alcohol and water doing this will remove any of the leftover wax or polish residue so I'm just going to tape up a little section of it just so you can see the before and after so I'm using a brand new microfiber applicator pad I'm going to shake it off so there's no lint on it I'm going to shake up my royal detail club wet and place it on the applicator pad in an X I use some royal detail Club zip to lubricate the pad you can use water or anything you have on hand I can lubricate it so I start by just working it in going in up and down motions as it gets worked in more and more I switch to crosshatch patterns and diagonal really important here is you just work in the product until it becomes clear it's going to require a lot of elbow grease after done polishing I grabbed a brand new microfiber or microfiber towel and I just wipe in you the residue off then I'd come back with a flashlight to look if there's any marks that need to be redone or any scratches I want to spend more time on here I'm using a brand new white microfiber applicator pad and some royal detail Clips shield carnauba wax I put the wax on the pad for such a little area you don't need to use much and I just work it in going up and down up and down they let haze over for about five minutes I take another clean microfiber towel and I just wipe off the wax residue I'm going to remove the tape in your yard you see a huge difference between the two sides I'm just going to clean off the tape residue with a little zip so here it is the tank is still lightly swirled however it is a hundred times better than what it was previously you can see a distinguished rectangle now

title: How to Polish Stainless Steel

content: hello everybody in today's video what we are going to do is we are going to clean the surface of our stainless steel refrigerator door and in one of my other videos the one in which I am pulling a dent out somebody happened to just shoot a comment out that said I should probably use a solvent on the entire refrigerator because I guess they thought it was a little bit dirty so anyway so what I'm going to do is show you the best way to clean the stainless steel on the refrigerator doors now of course most people use either olive oil or Pam or there's other things you can use you can use pledge and things like that to put a nice shine on the doors but before you put the shine on the doors what you really got to do is clean a stainless steel first so again in this video we're going to show you how I clean it and the way I do it is I simply take a clean sponge like this and what we're going to do is we're going to put some ordinary isopropyl alcohol on the sponge if you notice this sponge has two sides just like most sponges one has an abrasive side one is a more smooth softer side and we're going to completely saturate the sponge and then we're going to scrub the entire surface of the refrigerator all the stainless steel that you can see now what you don't realize is that application after application after application of your oils and stuff that you like to put on the refrigerator doors to shine it up and to take the fingerprints off eventually becomes actually very dirty you don't even know it but you're not going to realize it until you start trying to clean the refrigerator surface that's when you're going to notice all the dirt of course coming off on your sponge I think actually what happens is the oil becomes a trap for the dirt and just simply going over with more and more oil doesn't take the dirt off you have to take the dirt off first you need to strip the dirt and the oils off the refrigerator surface first before you give it a nice coat of oil next time and don't be afraid to put a little bit of elbow grease into it when you're using the sponge you're going to have to scrub a little bit and from time to time if you have to use the more abrasive side go ahead and use the more abrasive side I wouldn't use steel wool or anything but a good sponge with a rough side does a perfectly fine job taking off the difficult oil and dirt okay so there is what the sponge looks like from just a little bit of scrubbing and here we go want to speed it up a little bit show you what that looks like I'm going to add a little more alcohol to it don't be afraid to use the alcohol it's not going to hurt the metal and it's really going to do a good job of cleaning all the dirt and the oils off the surface metal of this refrigerator make sure you get it into all the little cracks onto the handles make sure you clean the handles and the one thing that I'm not showing in this video is that once you get done scrubbing the entire surface with the sponge and rubbing alcohol what I actually did was I wrung out the sponge in clean water several times and I went over the surface with clean water and the reason why I do that is because what happens is the the alcohol kind of leaves a little bit of a white film on the surface of the refrigerator so it's important that you get that white film off and then once we get the white film off that's when we're going to take out what I like to use I like to use Pam olive oil spray and I guess you could just get some regular olive oil put it on a rag and rub it rub it all over your refrigerator but I kind of use the Pam because I can spray it I kind of wish you can see this straight away if you could see this with your own two eyes you wouldn't believe what this refrigerator is looking like compared to the way it was before I mean the surface is almost like a mirror now from any angle that I look at it is so reflective so nice so shiny that it's pretty amazing and you can't get that shine by simply putting the oil on it you have to clean it first so anyway I hope you like this video I hope it helped this is definitely a good technique please subscribe please give me a thumbs up and I want to hear your comments have a great day

content: hello and welcome to skills and trade and today's exciting video we learn how to sand and polish some stainless steel to a mirror finish instead of using wd-40 like in our previous sanding and polishing videos today we're gonna use a luma cut but first I'm going to place instead of our spray bottle and then we're gonna mist all over the stainless steel sheet all right so now we're ready to sand so I'm gonna take our 220 grit sandpaper place it on our hook it pad then we're gonna take some of our luma cut then I'm gonna spray just a little bit on our 220 grit sandpaper it is important that we use a lumix as a lubricant for our sandpaper the key to sanding is to sand in a uniform fashion with approximately the same speed and we need to make sure we hit every inch of the stainless steel sheet ideally we're gonna want to sand away all the tarnish on the stainless steel sheet and we want to make sure that we do not sand too much in any one area so we can avoid divots in the metal now it is time for our next step which is our 400 grit sandpaper and like our 220 grit sandpaper before it we're just gonna place it on our hook a pad spray a little bit of Illuma to the sandpaper and then we're gonna begin sanding now we're gonna take another 400 grit sandpaper place it on our interface pad place it on our hooking pad they're going to slowly work back over the stainless steel sheet to help get rid of some of these lines so what the same kind of idea in mind we're gonna take our 800 grit sandpaper place it out our interface pad place it on our hook it pad and then we're gonna slowly work back over the stainless-steel sheet [Music] continuing with the same technique we're gonna take our 1500 grit sandpaper place it on our interface pad place it on a hook a pad and again we're gonna work over the stainless-steel sheet until we can start making it look like a mirror [Music] we are now ready for our second to last step so we're gonna take our three thousand grit try sack place it on our hook it pad spray with some illumined then we're gonna begin sanding and now finally we are ready for our 5000 grit track so we're gonna place it on our hook at ped spray with a little bit of a luma cut and then we're gonna begin sanding for the last time now that we're done sanding it is time to start polishing so we're gonna take our my Gers polishing pad place it on our hook at Pat and then we're going to take some of our gourds aluminum polish which actually works really well on stainless steel place it on our steel wool which is rated superfine and then we're gonna scrub it into the stainless steel until is black and then we're gonna begin polishing now the key to polishing is to move slowly and allow the drill to slowly work into polish until you get a mere shine so I made the mistake of trying to polish the stainless steel sheet on this hot summer's day after I just got done sanding so the metal was really hot and that made the Polish start to burn so what I had to do was to grab my steel wool place a little bit more polish onto the middle and just hand polish it with our Scot blue shop towels Wow now that is a brilliant mere shine I just want to thank you all so very much for watching please like and subscribe for more videos please leave a comment down in the comment box and have a wonderfull day

title: How to Polish Stainless Steel
original_title: How to Clean and Polish Metal
content: over time metal can become heavily oxidized and trying to clean or polish it without the right products can be tricky today I'm going to show you how to properly clean and polish the chrome or metal on your vehicle we will be using our medallion metal polish a microfiber towel a hand applicator and triple-zero steel wool so today we have this Nissan Armada here and the front bumper and Grille are just looking really bad and they really need cleaned and polished so first step is take your medallion and shake it really well once you shake up your medallion go ahead and apply three small dots onto your applicator next you're going to want to begin polishing in a circular motion applying firm pressure until you start to see that oxidation come off once you're finished take your microfiber towel and buff away the residue now for more heavily oxidized areas like the stain right here you're going to want to take your triple zero still wool and apply three small dots of medallion onto it and begin working it in circular motions until that Chrome starts to shine through now one thing you want to remember with this steel wool is you don't want to use it on stainless steel or any metal that has a plastic coating because it will scratch and once you're done you're going to want to take your microfiber towel and buff away any of the residue now even rough spots like the one right here can easily be removed with our medallion polish and some steel wool now our medallion will not only clean and polish but it also provides an extra layer of protection onto the vehicle's metal or crumb it can be used on all sorts of surfaces including brass silver stainless steel gold platinum and even aluminum so now we're going to go ahead and finish the rest of the grille and the bumper so as you can see the medallion did a great job on this chrome just look at all of this oxidation that it pulled up on to the applicator pad so for more information about metal cleaning and polishing visit us right here at detail King com where we have everything you need to keep your car clean like a detail King see you guys next time
